item.title: PUSHDATA4 unnecessary?
item.description:
PUSHDATA4 unnecessary?

Bitcoin Stack Exchange is a question and answer site for Bitcoin crypto-currency enthusiasts. It's 100% free, no registration required. Sign up Here's how it works: Anybody can ask a question Anybody can answer The best answers are voted up and rise to the top Any data push greater than 520 bytes in a Bitcoin transaction is not allowed ( https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/v0.10.0rc3/src/script/script.h#L18).

item.title: SAFE Crossroads Podcast #31, Harmen Klink
item.description:
SAFE Crossroads Podcast #31, Harmen Klink

In this Episode We're back again with Harmen Klink, talking about further innovations on the Decorum decentralized forum and social connection protocol. We talk about a web of trust function which will make the protocol very handy at evaluating one's connections and resisting unwanted connections.

item.title: What hardware and bandwidth requirements would a server need to fulfill to run Bitcore?
item.description:
What hardware and bandwidth requirements would a server need to fulfill to run Bitcore?

What's the cost of running Bitcore on AWS or DigitalOcean? I know I'd need about 128gb of hardrive space, but I'm not sure how much the typical bandwidth costs would be, and how much RAM or cores I...

item.title: Kraken Gains Series B Investment, Pushes Bitcoin Services & Ethereum in Japan
item.description:
Kraken Gains Series B Investment, Pushes Bitcoin Services & Ethereum in Japan

One of the largest bitcoin and cryptocurrency exchanges in the world, Kraken, has announced an investment from a leading Japanese foreign exchange brokerage, in the exchange's Series B round of financing. Cryptocurrency exchange Kraken has announced an investment from Tokyo-based Money Partners Group as a part of its Series B round of financing, in a press release today.

item.title: About 1 year ago I decided I wanted to do something to help Bitcoin but I lack sufficient coding skills. So I did something else and tomorrow I teach my first class on Bitcoin and Cryptocurrencies at my local community college. * /r/Bitcoin
item.description:

item.title: Bitcoin Price Watch; Live Bearish Entry! - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Watch; Live Bearish Entry! - NEWSBTC

Here's what we are focusing on in today's bitcoin price watch for the evening session on Wednesday. Also a live trade from this morning. Let's kick things off with a chart. The chart below shows the action we saw in the bitcoin price overnight, and the action that has taken place since we published the first of our twice daily bitcoin price watch articles this morning.
